title: Syria refugees: what you can do to help

details.body:
On 7 September the Prime Minister announced that the UK will resettle 20,000 Syrian refugees over the lifetime of this Parliament. We are working closely with the UN High Commissioner for Refugees to identify some of the most vulnerable displaced Syrians and bring them to the UK.

This scheme is helping those in the greatest need who cannot be supported effectively in the region by giving them protection and support in the UK. The criteria for acceptance under the scheme will be expanded to ensure more of those in need are resettled.

We have received many generous offers of support from the general public, local authorities, businesses and other organisations.

What to do if you want to help

What you are offering What to do
Local authorities  
I’m a local authority and I want to get more information on the scheme and how to participate. Read the information about refugees on the Local Government Association’s website.
   
I have a property that could be used to house refugees. If you’re a local authority, email the Local Government Association, clearly stating which area of the UK you are in.
Children - education providers  
I am a local authority or school looking for additional training to help build the emotional resilience of children in our care. Save the Children may have training opportunities that you’d be interested in.
Children - fostering  
I want to foster a child. It’s not possible currently to anticipate the level of foster places that will be needed. If you’re interested in fostering in general, contact your local authority to find out more about the process. If you live in Kent, Kent County Council is actively recruiting new foster carers for unaccompanied children. Otherwise you can apply to foster a child through your council on GOV.UK if you live in England and Wales. You could contact one of these national organisations that help with fostering in the UK: Fosterline, [Homes For Good](http://www.homesforgood.org], Coram
I’m a foster carer and would like further training to help meet the specific needs of children in my care Save the Children may have training opportunities that you’d be interested in.
Religious organisations  
I have religious premises available Email the Local Government Association, stating which area of the UK you are in.
General public  
I have a property that could be used to house refugees Contact your local housing association or council.
I have a free room in my house. We don’t anticipate a need to accommodate Syrian refugees using a hosting model. Many organisations in the UK operate accommodation hosting projects to help vulnerable asylum seekers and refugees.
I want to volunteer to help refugees. Several charities and organisations are working with refugees across the UK. To find out more about volunteering opportunities in your area visit: the National Council for Voluntary Organisations, Volunteer Scotland, Volunteer Wales or Volunteer Now (Northern Ireland). You could also contact the Refugee Council.
I’m a professional who could help refugees integrate on arrival in the UK. Contact the Refugee Council.
I just want to do something to help. Donate to the Refugee Council.
I have clothes / books / toys etc that I want to donate. We’ve been inundated with incredibly generous offers of donated goods from members of the public. Because of the logistical challenges in storing and transporting dontated items, we can’t accept any donations currently. Check with branches of your local refugee organisations to see what they need. You can also donate items to Save the Children charity shops. The items won’t go directly to child refugees but the money raised helps us to support them.
I’m a business and have an idea that could help green
I have a query that is not listed above. yellow
I want to help refugees overseas. You can support Save the Children’s Child Refugee Crisis Appeal. Our teams are working across Europe and in the countries they are fleeing to provide aid and support.
